stream_context.summary: Kaze spends the session importing and debugging Biobak’s major re-work of Course 10 (“Egg Escape” area), fixing model and behavior bugs (especially a new Yoshi and donut boss), tweaking visual details for real hardware, and explaining his low-level optimisation philosophy.

development_findings.summary: A re-export of Course 10 failed because two textures shared a name, triggering the N64 colour-count error; renaming one texture fixed it.
development_findings.quote: We literally fixed this yesterday … there must be two textures with the same name. Okay, this is fixable.

development_findings.summary: Kaze has cleared nearly all engine bugs and reduced compiler warnings to zero, claiming the codebase is now warning-free.
development_findings.quote: I am slowly approaching zero engine bugs … I got my entire compiler down to zero warnings as well.

development_findings.summary: Actor update order is now optimised by alphabetically renaming instances so identical behaviours sit contiguously in memory, improving instruction-cache locality.
development_findings.quote: Actors execute their code in order of what they're named … that makes it so we get a little bit better cache proximity.

development_findings.summary: Hardware z-fighting on grass overhangs was solved by extending the mesh so the seam sits outside the camera frustum.
development_findings.quote: I had to make one change … make them actually hang over here so that this just kind of disappears.

development_findings.summary: Environment-colour lighting is disabled across the project due to a Fast64 exporter bug; primitive colour is used instead for per-vertex tint and bush-brightness randomisation.
development_findings.quote: We can’t use environment colour … we always use primitive colour when we can.

development_findings.summary: Mario’s behaviour loop now fits entirely in the N64 instruction cache; benchmark showed only two cycles between blocks, proving zero I-cache misses.
development_findings.quote: My game by itself is already so optimised that Mario's behaviour loop never gets thrown out of cache.

development_findings.summary: Entity-component systems were rejected; Kaze prefers direct function calls and memory ordering for performance.
development_findings.quote: Entity component system is complete garbage … just order the actors correctly in memory.

development_findings.summary: New high-poly Yoshi model from Biobak required armature re-hookup, collision reassignment, and code fixes (dialogue duplicating, fruit-eating flag, missing animation).
Donut boss model imported with illegal dual-texture cycle and wrong scale (+28%); Kaze rebuilt material to one-cycle and resized.
Sliding-floor trap now translates sideways instead of dropping; needs mirrored geometry and duplicate collisions because exporter can’t mirror collisions automatically.

context_findings.summary: Kaze’s design philosophy: only two real languages—assembly and high-level C—everything in between (ECS, complex C standards) is ‘mental illness’.
context_findings.quote: There are only two programming languages and that's assembly and high level … anything after that is mental illness.

context_findings.summary: Shows excitement and pride over visual quality, claiming it’s the best-looking N64 title ever, but also frustration with Blender UI changes and Windows 11 task-bar crashes.
Mentions being ‘banished to the basement’ by his wife Zeina, hinting at a home-studio setup.
context_findings.quote: I am in the basement. Zeina’s banished me here.

context_findings.summary: Launched TeePublic merch (one shirt per course) but YouTube integration takes two days, causing mild annoyance.

biobak.summary: Delivered a full Course 10 asset pack: revised geometry, new bushes with scratch-marks, collapsible floor, Yoshi + donut models, and changelog of actor IDs.
Collaborates in real time on colour balancing (bush brightness, outlines) and collision decisions.

zeina.summary: Not directly on stream but noted to have relegated Kaze’s workspace to the basement, implying personal boundaries within the household.

key_stories.title: Texture-Name Bug Returns
key_stories.summary: A colour-limit error (material 242) re-appeared while importing Course 10 despite being ‘fixed yesterday’. Investigation revealed two textures shared a filename, breaching Fast64’s limits. Renaming resolved it.
key_stories.challenge: Import failed with ‘texture has too many colours’ error.
key_stories.process: Kaze inspected logs, suspected duplicate texture names, searched material list, renamed offending file, re-exported.
key_stories.outcome: Level now compiles; highlights fragility of asset-naming pipeline.
key_stories.key_quote: Two textures with the same name … okay, this is fixable.

key_stories.title: Zero I-cache Miss Breakthrough
key_stories.summary: Kaze benchmarked Mario’s behaviour loop and discovered it never leaves the instruction cache, validating weeks of function-ordering optimisation.
key_stories.challenge: Quantify cost of cache misses on real hardware.
key_stories.process: Inserted cycle-counter tests between 0x20-byte code blocks; measured only two cycles.
key_stories.outcome: Confidence that manual actor-ordering approach works; reinforces stance against ECS.
key_stories.key_quote: Mario's behaviour loop never gets thrown out of cache – which is crazy.

key_stories.title: Yoshi Model Overhaul
key_stories.summary: Biobak’s new Yoshi replaces the placeholder but initial import broke tongue bones, collision, and dialogue logic.
key_stories.challenge: Integrate complex new model without breaking gameplay.
key_stories.process: Re-hooked armature in Blender, fixed OBJ list flag from ‘spawner’ to ‘surface’, deleted obsolete cutscene flags, added missing animation frames.
key_stories.outcome: Yoshi now renders, follows Mario with eyes, and can be entered, though double-dialogue bug remains.
key_stories.key_quote: We fixed him enough to where we can go into him – that’s all we needed.

open_questions.context: Kaze teased a user-voted competition with cash prizes for ROM-hack releases.
questions: Who is sponsoring F3 2025 and what are the terms?
How will user voting be handled fairly?
What prize pool and categories are planned?

open_questions.context: Environment colour is disabled due to a Fast64 bug; primitive colour now drives all vertex tinting.
questions: What exactly is the Fast64 issue preventing environment colour?
Could a tool-chain fix re-enable it for future flexibility?
How does the team coordinate colour variation when only primitive colour is available?

open_questions.context: Actor naming is manually arranged to cluster identical behaviours.
questions: How scalable is this manual ordering as the project grows?
Are there tooling plans to automate cache-friendly ordering?
Any measurable FPS gains on console after re-ordering?

open_questions.context: Yoshi still opens dialogue twice despite model fixes.
questions: What exactly causes the double-dialogue trigger?
Does it relate to new object lists or cutscene flags?
Will this require engine-level change or script tweak?

open_questions.context: New collapsible floor now slides sideways and needs mirrored collision export.
questions: Why can the exporter not mirror collisions automatically?
Will duplicating collision data impact memory budgets?
Is there a plan to generalise this mechanic for reuse?
